page.title: 04Road & rail Transport
page.content: Although near main routes,for a long time the Royal forest kept this area isolated.The Northampton rail loop was built after nearly every other city had been connected to the rail system.Its only purpose locally was to provide jobs temporarily and keep half of Ashton warmer by 2 degrees C by making a barrier to cold air flowing downhill from Hartwell.The villages are poorly served by unclassified roads on which there have been several bad accidents. Winter driving is always dangerous.As Hartwell is supposed to be a dormitory village for Northampton & Milton Keynes it is srange the roads shouldbe bad.As the M1 passes right by Hartwell a link to it would have helped but only a police turning point that leads to the forest exists and ordinary traffic is not supposed to use it.Nicola Maltby,11
